thread.title: State Dept urges lifting of holds on ambassadorial nominees
thread.title_full: State Dept urges lifting of holds on ambassadorial nominees

title: State Dept urges lifting of holds on ambassadorial nominees
text:
Updated: 4:52 p.m. Wednesday, Oct. 7, 2015 | Posted: 4:52 p.m. Wednesday, Oct. 7, 2015 State Dept urges lifting of holds on ambassadorial nominees By MATTHEW LEE The Associated Press WASHINGTON — 
The State Department is calling on Senate Republicans to stop blocking nominees for roughly two dozen ambassadorial and senior agency posts, saying the holds are interfering with the conduct of U.S. diplomacy. 
Spokesman John Kirby said Wednesday all the nominees should be confirmed to their positions as soon as possible, particularly those who are being blocked for reasons that have nothing to do with the State Department. 
The holds include three ambassadorial nominees — those to the Bahamas, Norway and Sweden — are being held up by Sen. Tom Cotton of Arkansas until the Secret Service takes disciplinary action against employees who improperly accessed a congressman's employment records. 
Individual senators have the authority to place a hold on presidential nominations. At least 23 State Department nominees are affected. Copyright The Associated Press
